entry.title: a North Carolina dive bar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Washington Post described a North Carolina dive bar (pictured) as "a middle finger to the development surrounding it"?

entry.title: Lepas testudinata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lepas testudinata can form colonies of more than 1000 members at a time?

entry.title: Michael Goldstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Patti Smith posed for a racy photograph in Michael Goldstein's rooftop wading pool?

entry.title: Palestinian hikaye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Palestinian hikaye is a unique form of folk culture performed by older women in winter?

entry.title: Larry Nagler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that tennis player Arthur Ashe only realized that his doubles partner Larry Nagler was Jewish when he was invited to Nagler's home for lox and bagels?

entry.title: Teratoscincus roborowskii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the gecko Teratoscincus roborowskii eats caper fruits and disperses the plant's seeds in its feces?

entry.title: Weekends with Adele (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the end of her Weekends with Adele shows, Adele vanishes?

entry.title: Henk Zwartepoorte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Henk Zwartepoorte quacked at caimans?
